page.title: 06Kimblesworth Colliery
page.content: Kimblesworth is now without its colliery. Once the village was entirely centred around 'the Pit'. All the houses were colliery houses. Now few 'pitmen' reside in the village and they work in the coastal collieries. One retired miner who worked for 24 years in the mine recalls pushing coal trolleys along tunnels only 75cm high. Electricity which is now taken for granted was provided by colliery generator for the village but was not available during the night. The site of the colliery has changed - gone are the winding gear, the railway and the bridge which used to carry it over the A1. In the pit yard small businesses have been set up, such as a small steel manufacturing company and 2 vehicle repair shops.
